vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/721c2c72-1659-422f-b1ae-9aa3b94fa663">VOTING INTENTION</keyword>         <topcClas>Social attitudes and behaviour - Society and culture</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Northern Ireland Life and Times Survey</i> (NILT) series began in 1998, and was the successor to the previous <i>Northern Ireland Social Attitudes</i> series, (held at the UK Data Archive under SN 33235), which was discontinued in 1996. The aims of the NILT series are:<ul><li>to monitor public attitudes towards social policy and political issues in Northern Ireland</li><li>to provide a time series on attitudes to key social policy areas</li><li>to facilitate academic social policy analysis</li><li>to provide a freely available resource on public attitudes for the wider community of users in Northern Ireland</li></ul>NILT originally had a companion series which also began in 1998, the <i>Young Life and Times Survey</i> (YLT) (see under SN 33313), although the YLT methodology changed in 2003. NILT also forms part of the <a href="http://www.issp.org/" title ="International Social Survey Programme">International Social Survey Programme</a> (ISSP), although it does not do so every year. Unfortunately, the NILT team were unable to obtain full funding to run NILT in 2011, though YLT ran as normal that year. NILT resumed in 2012 - see SN 7408. In addition, two open access teaching datasets were created from NILT 2012, one covering Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual and Transgender (LGBT) issues and the other covering  politics and good relations (see SNs 7546 and 7547 respectively).<br> <br> Further information about the NILT series may be found on the ARK (Access Research Knowledge) <a href="http://www.ark.ac.uk/nilt/" title="NILT">NILT</a> webpages.<br> <br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The 2005 NILT survey covered: <ul><li>gender and family roles</li><li>complementary medicine and health issues</li><li>democratic participation</li><li>political attitudes</li><li>attitudes to ethnic minority people</li><li>community relations</li><li>background information on respondents</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="2005-10-01T00:00:00Z">October 2005</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2006-01-01T00:00:00Z">January 2006</collDate>         <nation>Northern Ireland</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Northern Irish adults</universe>         <universe>Adults aged 18 or over living in private households in Northern Ireland during 2005.</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <dataCollector>Research and Evaluation Services</dataCollector>         <sampProc>One-stage stratified or systematic random sample</sampProc>         <collMode>Face-to-face interview; Self-completion</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used.
